name: redpanda.remote.read
documentation: Fetches data from cloud storage to Redpanda.

name: redpanda.remote.write
documentation: Uploads data from Redpanda to cloud storage.

name: redpanda.remote.delete
documentation: To delete a topic without removing its data in the cloud bucket, set redpanda.remote.delete to false before deleting the topic.

name: redpanda.remote.recovery
documentation: Recovers or reproduces a topic from cloud storage. Use this flag during topic creation. It does not apply to existing topics.

name: retention.local.target.bytes
documentation: When a topic is enabled for remote write, retention.ms and retention.bytes specify the retention policy for data in the cloud. Retention.local.target.{ms|bytes} specify the local retention policy in this scenario. If the topic is not enabled for remote write, these options are ignored.

name: retention.local.target.ms
documentation: When a topic is enabled for remote write, retention.ms and retention.bytes specify the retention policy for data in the cloud. Retention.local.target.{ms|bytes} specify the local retention policy in this scenario. If the topic is not enabled for remote write, these options are ignored.

name: redpanda.iceberg.delete
documentation: Whether the corresponding Iceberg table is deleted upon deleting the topic.

name: redpanda.iceberg.invalid.record.action
documentation: Whether to write invalid records to a dead-letter queue (DLQ).

name: redpanda.iceberg.mode
documentation: Enable the Iceberg integration for the topic. You can choose one of four modes.

name: redpanda.iceberg.partition.spec
documentation: The partitioning specification for the Iceberg table.

name: redpanda.iceberg.target.lag.ms
documentation: Controls how often the data in the Iceberg table is refreshed with new data from the topic. Redpanda attempts to commit all data produced to the topic within the lag target, subject to resource availability.

name: redpanda.remote.readreplica
documentation: The name of the object storage bucket for a Remote Read Replica topic. Not to be used with redpanda.remote.read or redpanda.remote.write.

name: flush.bytes
documentation: The maximum bytes not fsynced per partition. If this configured threshold is reached, the log is automatically fsynced, even though it wasnâ€™t explicitly requested.

name: initial.retention.local.target.bytes
documentation: A size-based initial retention limit for Tiered Storage that determines how much data in local storage is transferred to a partition replica when a cluster is resized. If null (default), all locally retained data is transferred.

name: initial.retention.local.target.ms
documentation: A time-based initial retention limit for Tiered Storage that determines how much data in local storage is transferred to a partition replica when a cluster is resized. If null (default), all locally retained data is transferred.

name: redpanda.leaders.preference
documentation: The preferred location (rack) for partition leaders of a topic.

name: replication.factor
documentation: The number of replicas of a topic to save in different nodes (brokers) of a cluster. If replication.factor is set to a positive value, it overrides the cluster property default_topic_replication for the topic.

name: write.caching
documentation: The write caching mode to apply to a topic.
